sub_title: Commercial Contract & Fleet Manager, TCR North Europe | Ground Support Equipment (GSE) solutions for Aviation ✈️ | Family Man 👨‍👩‍👧‍👦  |  Vegan 🌱 | Runner 🏃
summary:
I am an impact-driven professional working as Commercial Contract & Fleet Manager at TCR, the leading global provider of GSE (Ground Support Equipment) solutions for the aviation industry. 

Prior to this, I worked for 12 years in the impact sector in Southeast Asia. I held various leadership roles at the non-profit organisation SOLS 24/7 where I was responsible for the management and implementation of large-scale education and social projects for under-served communities in Malaysia.

I have extensive experience in organisational strategy, operational management, project management, fundraising, stakeholder management, and impact monitoring & management, through managing projects in the fields of education, sustainable development, and renewable energy. 

Between 2020 and 2022, I led the operations of a solar energy startup in Kuala Lumpur during the pandemic and accomplished more than 3.5 MW of solar PV installations for homeowners in Malaysia.

I have a strong passion for sustainability, environment, and education, and it is my personal mission to contribute towards a better world through my daily actions.

projects.title: Nationwide English Programme (Bahasa Inggeris 1Malaysia | 2017)
projects.description:
BI1M 2017 (Bahasa Inggeris 1Malaysia) was a nationwide initiative by the Ministry of Finance, implemented by SOLS 24/7, to improve the standard of English in Malaysia. The programme was offered across 17 locations, mainly in Urban Transformation Centres (UTC) and Rural Transformation Centres (RTC), at strategic hubs for public services. With 11,318 graduates, the second year of BI1M proved to be even more successful than the inaugural edition in 2016. 

The programme provided basic communicative English to Malaysian working adults, students, housewives, and senior citizens, boosting their confidence in the language and encouraging the use of English as a second language in Malaysia. BI1M did not only enable Malaysians to build confidence in the English language but also contribute to the country's growth, in line with its aspirations to emerge as a developed economy by 2020.

contributors.headline: Commercial Contract & Fleet Manager, TCR North Europe | Ground Support Equipment (GSE) solutions for Aviation ✈️ | Family Man 👨‍👩‍👧‍👦  |  Vegan 🌱 | Runner 🏃

projects.title: Nationwide English Programme (Bahasa Inggeris 1Malaysia | 2016)
projects.description:
The Bahasa Inggeris 1Malaysia (BI1M) 2016 programme was a nationwide initiative under the National Blue Ocean Strategy (NBOS), implemented by the Ministry of Finance in partnership with SOLS 24/7. The BI1M programme aimed to raise the standard of English in Malaysia by teaching communicative English to Malaysians in urban and rural areas. 

In line with Malaysia’s aspirations to emerge as a developed country, BI1M contributed to the nation’s growth by enabling Malaysian citizens to build confidence in the English language while encouraging the use of English as a second language. BI1M was open to all Malaysian citizens from 7 years to 77 years old, especially small business owners/entrepreneurs, housewives, retirees, children, and youth with a household income of RM4,000 and below who wish to improve their English language skills.

A total of 8,720 Malaysians graduated from the programme across 17 locations during the project period from 1st of March 2016 to 31st July 2016.

profile_positions.location: Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
profile_positions.description:
SOLS Energy:
📈  Responsible for setting business goals and strategies to achieve performance and growth targets. Increased the revenue of the company by 300% despite the pandemic and lockdowns in Malaysia.
👷 Oversaw the daily operations of the company and managing team leaders for a team of 50 staff under the operational departments and Human Resources. Responsible for the operations of 3.6 MW of solar PV installations for 550 residential clients in 2021.
🎯 Designed and implemented new and improved processes and policies to increase efficiency and effectiveness, and reduce cost and critical risks.
📊 Driven continuous growth and innovation through monitoring, evaluating, and learning from key metrics and operational insights related to KPI’s, critical risks, and trends.
👥 Lead the HR department and responsible for the development and delivery of strategic HR plans to meet talent management and acquisition targets.
🤝 Member of the Management team as Director of Operations.
🧩 Written and developed Strategic Document for sustained impact and development (SOLS Foundation).

SOLS Energy is a Malaysian green energy company with a mission to democratise solar energy and turn every roof into an asset. We connect people and businesses to sustainable energy solutions and enable our clients to reduce their carbon footprint and save on electricity bills, while taking charge of their energy consumption. We are technology-enthusiasts, sustainability-activists and energy-visionaries who are on the way to provide clean energy to every house. We are leaders in the residential solar market and enable SMEs to operate more efficiently.
profile_positions.title: Chief Operating Officer

profile_positions.location: Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
profile_positions.description:
🌐 Designed, managed and implemented a free online education platform with live classes for students, teachers, and professionals affected by the COVID-19 pandemic. The platform has reached 80,000+ beneficiaries since March 2020.
📚 Responsible for the business operations and management of learning & development programmes and certification for 3,850 professionals, teachers, and university students in English, business communications and digital skills.
🇬🇧 Managed and implemented English and business communication courses and Cambridge certification for 575 employees and university students.
👨‍💻 Managed and implemented digital skills training, webinars, and certification for 3,275 school teachers in partnership with the State Education Department and Google for Education.

SOLS smart is a leading English & Digital education company. We enable organisations, employees, teachers, and students to develop their talent and capacity through learning & development programmes in English language, business communication, digital skills and Google Certified Educator (GCE).

We are a HRDF-registered training provider, a Cambridge English accredited centre, and a Google for Education partner.
profile_positions.title: Managing Director

profile_positions.location: Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
profile_positions.description:
🏛️ Responsible for the setup, management, and implementation of 75 community centres across Malaysia which impacted 30,000+ beneficiaries from low-income communities. The project was awarded by UNESCO Asia Pacific for its innovative education design.
👥 Managed and implemented a nationwide English programme (BI1M) for the Malaysian Ministry of Finance for two consecutive years whereby 20,000 beneficiaries were trained across 35 locations.
🏢 Managed the daily office operations and led a team of local and international staff. Throughout the years I have worked with more than 1,000 staff from 50 nationalities.
💰 Developed fundraising proposals and raised funds from corporate partners and foundations to fund the non-profit activities of the organisation. I raised more than MYR 25 million (€5 million) through initiating and maintaining donor relations. 
🤝 Established and maintained relationships with major funders, corporate partners, ministries, government agencies, foundations, NGO’s and other stakeholders
📝 Created and written donor- and impact reports for our partners.
📈 Designed, developed, and implemented impact frameworks and processes for monitoring, evaluation, learning, and innovation.
👨‍💼 Centre Exam Manager (CEM) for Cambridge English Language Assessments.
💼 Represented the organisation at local and international meetings, events, and conferences.

SOLS 24/7 is an award-winning humanitarian organisation, committed to serve, educate and empower people from low-income communities. Through various education and social empowerment programmes, we work unconditionally towards transforming underserved communities to develop their true potential and break the cycle of poverty. 

Impact achieved:
- 21 years of transforming lives through education & social projects.
- 400,000+ beneficiaries trained across ASEAN.
- 100+ training centres established across Malaysia.

SOLS 24/7 Foundation is a tax-exempted, not-for-profit organisation, registered in Malaysia.
